greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Wolstenholme quotient of prime p=A000040(n), i.e., such integer m
comment: a(n) = 0 iff A000040(n) is a Wolstenholme prime (given by A088164).
link: David W. Boyd, A p-adic study of the partial sums of the harmonic series, Experimental Math., Vol. 3 (1994), No. 4, 287-302.
R. Mestrovic, Wolstenholme's theorem: Its Generalizations and Extensions in the last hundred and fifty years (1862-2011), arXiv:1111.3057 [math.NT], 2011.
R. Mestrovic, On a Congruence Modulo n^3 Involving Two Consecutive Sums of Powers, Journal of Integer Sequences, Vol. 17 (2014), 14.8.4.
Jianqiang Zhao, Bernoulli numbers, Wolstenholme's theorem, and p^5 variations of Lucas' theorem, Journal of Number Theory, Volume 123, Issue 1, March 2007, Pages 18-26.
formula: a(n) = (-1/3)*B(p-3) mod p, with p=prime(n) and B(n) is the n-th Bernoulli number. - _Michel Marcus_, Feb 05 2016
results.author: _Max Alekseyev_, May 13 2010
